sentences: Lorne Lofsky (born May 10, 1954) is a Canadian jazz guitarist who was a member of the Oscar Peterson Quartet.
In the 1970s, he attended York University in Toronto and studied music while working at clubs in Toronto.
In 1980, Lofsky met Canadian pianist Oscar Peterson, who produced his first album, It Could Happen to You.
He toured with Peterson in the 1980s, and he toured and recorded as a member of Peterson's quartet and quintet in the 1990s.
From 1983 to 1991 Lofsky played in a quartet with jazz guitarist Ed Bickert.
